I believe its not as simple as "Mojang only cares about Java" as some commentors seem to imply. IANA Mojang employee nor am I personally well versed in their team structure, but its highly likely the programmers and team that work on the JE April Fools snapshots are not the developers for BE, as both versions run on very different codebases. It would not only increase the workload of them, but if both April Fools are the same, it should also be considered that adding April Fools snapshots to BE would significantly affect the workload and make other actual features take longer to implement

It would defeat one of the major purposes of them: they are basically tech demos/places where Mojang experiments with ideas or certain concepts. If Mojang developers are bound by technical limitations of BE it would make it much harder to focus on and test experimental ideas, which would also hinder motivation to work on what was previously a fun place to vent some of their creativity and play around with ideas.

There is also the issue that is my own personal "headcanon", but I personally view BE as "Microsoft's Minecraft", won't get into why, but I could see Microsoft not wanting employees of the new Minecraft version wasting time on April Fools gags, while Java can get away with it as it is a long-standing tradition

 

But the idea of an April Fools for Bedrock edition isn't bad, it'd likely have to be on a smaller scale though. But in the end, I suspect its up to the Microsoft overlords.
yes! i only play on bedrock, and tis would be pretty funny. although they might have to change the menu so you can choose which snapshot to play in.

Following this, having the ability to place Lanterns (And now possibly Chains) on the underside of Trapdoors would be amazing! There are so many builds that I find and want to do, but being Bedrock I have to find a work around or scrap the idea. This would be amazing for the parody and make it so the versions are more seamless in the instruction and build department.
Yes we need it as well as parity with what lanterns can be placed or hung
Yes please! It adds a layer of depth to a build and reduces the need for clunkier half slabs. Lanterns and even item frames would be a fantastic addition as well.

In addition to flower pots, there are also several other items that cannot be placed on trapdoors in Bedrock Edition. Someone mentioned that you cannot hang lanterns from the bottom of trapdoors. You canâ€™t place them on top of trapdoors either. You also canâ€™t place sea pickles, doors, pressure plates, snow layers (top snow), beds, scaffolding, or rails. You also canâ€™t place ladders on the side of open trapdoors, which is another very commonly used trick on Java Edition. There might be a few more, but I have yet to confirm them.
been waiting for this for a long time. i really wish they will let us do this in bedrock or mcpe. i wonder if they really read this feedback

This is a major parity feature for builders and I'm surprised it hasn't been added or talked about more considering its usefulness and how widespread its use is on Java! I'm sure that you meant this by your suggestion, but I believe that trapdoors should function the same on bedrock as they do on Java (build-wise, I'm not trying to get into the whole one block tall movement discussion). It would be so nice to be able to put flower pots, item frames, lanterns, sea pickles, carpets, etc. on trapdoors as well being able to hang item frames on the side of the block instead of having to use the bulky slab in its place. Slabs are not only clunky looking because of their size in a shelf (or desk) type build, but also because their texture is the same as the stair block that it is often "supported" by. I'm sorry to ramble on, but in my eyes, this is the most important parity feature not yet announced or added to bedrock edition.

The potential construction patterns provided by this small change would make the Bedrock Edition just that much better. Let's hope for a quick change, as the mushroom block glitch was fixed relatively quickly. Fingers crossed!!!

Please let this happen. There are so many decor & designs that I wanna try but I simply can't because I'm using Bedrock. It honestly makes me so sad. This one and holding torch in the other hand feature are needed in Bedrock imo. I know I would enjoy playing much more.
I've been waiting for this since forever. I really wish they would consider this on bedrock. There are a lot of wonderful builds we could do with this.
java flower pots float on air but in bedrock they instantly break

Iâ€™m really frustrated by the inability to use trap doors in Bedrock in the same way Java does. I build with a lot of realism to create a fun and pleasant atmosphere to play in. The use of trap doors as a thinner shelf option or to hang things from is too important to the aesthetic side of building! Not all of us build massively huge structures on a scale that would allow slabs to look proper. The majority of Minecraft players build much, much smaller for a size suitable to a two block high character. Slabs just dont allow for that in the typical small spaces without looking clunky and hogging precious visual space.

This omission of use is too obvious and for far too long. Itâ€™s like tossing one kid a highly detailed miniature house kit with all the finer details and accessories to work with but then tossing another kid a bag of Mega Blocks expecting them to be just as stimulated and satisfied. Itâ€™s just not the same. Imagination using the Mega Blocks is limited by age, and many of us are adults wanting adult level creativity, and even older kids outgrow Mega Blocks.

Why does Minecraft overlook these important elements and not provide the feature after years of complaining by players? You have a huge devoted base, Minecraft, reward them by fixing these obvious omissions first.
Yes we need this for builders in minecraft bedrock
Walls as well. You can attach flower pots to walls in Java but not in Bedrock. I've also tried placing on wool carpet and nope.

Flower pots, ladders, rails, lanterns, torches, candles, sea pickles, etc etc. Bedrock is so crippled aesthetically when decorating yet Java has always had this ability. Please include this in the next update! It has been sat on for too long and itâ€™s ruining the fun of play.

In Bedrock candles cannot be placed on top of lightning rods which in Java it makes a perfect candle stick so you don't have to place the candles on the floor or on chunky blocks. Seeing a lot of castle interior build in Java where this is used. Would be great if Bedrock would just match all block placements of the Java edition.
i agree, i have to use slabs and it just doesn't give it the same effect, yknow?

The addition of intricate things such as being able to place lanterns or flowerpots on trapdoors would greatly benefit Bedrock players and make the game that much more enjoyable. With there being limited actions from Java and Bedrock a separate player base is created for the same game. Though the ones to notice this change would mainly be those following â€œhow to buildâ€¦â€ Minecraft tutorials; it would fix the insurmountable situation between bedrock players and Java players. Now today many players in bedrock are limited with their choices when wanting to build and instead of having the fun creativity and experience that is Minecraft they are left to work around their predicament simply because bedrock does not allow the same things as Java. To each side there are pros and cons but doing something seeming so minor that is believed to go unnoticed will undoubtedly make a significant improvement to the game. At least the change will be significant for the players who are trying to place flower pots suspended in the air or on a trap door etc. The change would seem minor now but eventually become the norm in the Minecraft community. If bedrock players are granted the opportunity to do these things such as Java players do it would alter how we view the game for the better.

- casual bedrock user
I love and support you. please return the 1% of it to us and at least respond to why we can't have this parity change.

The Terraforged mod does a fantastic job improving forests, without the addition of any new content- and it consists of some really simple tweaks. The ground cover consists not solely of grass, but also of podzol and coarse dirt- there's a bit more foliage, and the trees have some slightly larger models, which also vary based on altitude.

Pretty sure no one reads these comments. However, Custardly23's idea is good. Yes, shields do exist. They are very good at their job, maybe too good, to the point that it slows down combat. The sword (in the older versions of Minecraft Java) does not fully block damange, but makes combat faster. For the sword block and shield to exist in the same game would, require changes to balance them.

When it comes to balancing, the sword allows you to block still, but in turn, you still take damange from all angles. Shields would still preform the same way, but with added withdraw backs. Like every time you block, there is a delay which is longer than their current version. During the deployment time, if you get hit, your shield isn't going to work. This would require players to think ahead before putting the shield up. If deployed on time, you will be rewarded with all damnage blocked from wherever you face. Another debuff, is the player taking the twice more damnage if the attacking player or mob hits you, if you attack with the shield up. Making it more risky to hid behind a shield. The sword would be the more the risk-taking, and the shield being the more cautious play-style.

That is not touching how sheilds can be balance more with tiers, along with maybe a weight system. Wood is what we sort of have currently, would be the fastest among all the shields when rised. In returned, wood is weakest. Netherrite shields would be slowest, but strongest with a knockback reduction.
same i wish i can block
I don't think it should use sword durability, it wouldn't make sense for it to do that
Bruh just use shield its much easier
Shields exist but it would be helpful if you dont have iron yet. Maybe to balance it out it costs 1.5 or up to 3 times as much durability to block with a sword then a shield.

I like all the Ideas. I would say that maybe the swords could have a chance (maybe 1 of 7 or something) chance of blocking an arrow, while a shield always does, giving shields a purpose but still having a source of defense against a skeleton on your first night, So instead of just running away, you could still defend yourself. Also, originally you could block creeper explosions with a sword. But what would happen in real life if you tried to block the blast of a bomb? Either the sword would break, or worse, you would hit yourself. For this reason, I think you should not be able to block a creeper blast with a sword, but instead, the sword would break if you tried, to make it a little more life-like. Finally, to give sword fights more of a sense of matching, a wooden sword would almost immediately break if blocking a Netherite sword, compared to a Netherrite sword against a Netherite sword. That way, you will still want to upgrade to a better sword, therefore keeping the rest of the game's purpose relating to swords, while allowing more epic fighting capabilities.

Not going to happen devs confirmed in a recent ask Mojang because they said" Bedrock won't get 1.9 pvp because they are already redoing the pvp system" and jeb said on twitter the exact same thing on twitter very recently but they should return sword blocking.

Bit of a follow up post given the thread is place in the category of parity (which you should check before reading this post.) I propose a few solutions to allow the return of the old sword block.

The easiest method of adding it back in is to use crouch button as a single tap instead of a double tap (of course make it a optional for everyone.) The double tap for Minecraft Bedrock with touch screen controls lead to many times where there is a skeleton attacking and the player not being able to put a shield up on time. To block with a sword you first need to have nothing in your other hand, and you just need to crouch to block. However, there is no ability to duel wield which is important to prevent shields from losing their use given by using a sword, you are only reducing the damage and not blocking it. 

Also, I don't know why I thought this was a good idea, but it might work. When duel wielding in mobile, you can have it so if you tap on a item in your second hand activity, you'll switch over to it on the fly. Might be a little clunky but it could solve some parity issues, I think... It could also be optional to have it work automatically and would remove the need to crouch to block.
It might be a nice feature so I think that you could do it when your not using a shield, but a shield just is a more effective way of blocking.
